executive_summary: Revenue for moving companies in the United States has risen modestly during the current period despite significant volatility. Noticeable slumps in housing starts and mild drops in housing sales have affected the market for moving services. Despite these factors, the essential need for such services, particularly to help businesses relocate their operations, has kept revenue expanding throughout 2024. However, the changing economic landscape has burdened consumers with higher costs, painting a mixed picture of this industry's revenue in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Housing Market is Crucial in Affecting Industry Revenue
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Activity in the residential sector, which includes those moving to a new home or into an existing home, requires more furniture to be transported with this culling for more services from moving companies. Since spending from households comprises the majority of moving companies' revenue, the housing market's performance has the most significant effect on the industry.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: THE BUSINESS SECTOR HAS RALLIED GAINS WHILE WEATHERING STORMS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: With the economy recovering, downstream activity has supplemented this industry by relying on various commercial sectors that depend on moving services to handle their needs in transporting goods to different locations where they'll be operating. But lately, the business sector has also had to contend with environmental changes as the economy remains more inflationary.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: HIGH INTEREST RATES HAVE THREATENED MOVING COMPANIES
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Inflationary pressures remain a factor in many industries that have to factor in more costs on their operations. In response, the Federal Reserve has been enacting a policy of quantitative tightening while keeping interest rates high to tame rising prices and hopefully discourage more spending. Ballooning mortgage rates have made purchasing a new or existing home much more expensive for many consumers, reducing spending on moving services from households.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: VOLATILE OIL PRICES HAVE BEEN A BLESSING AND A CURSE
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Changes in oil prices have brought on more volatility. Even though the production of such inputs has risen recently, factors that have kept energy costs up, like geopolitical tensions, have also been factors that have been molding the cost of such items that companies have to absorb. Many companies in this industry, especially those that operate mainly in packaging and transportation, can sometimes pass these price increases onto consumers, leading to elevated revenue and profit.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: SPENDING FROM THE CORPORATE SECTOR WILL GROW
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Economic recovery is key and instrumental for the industry, which relies on various downstream markets that depend on lower inflationary pressures to boost their activity and investments. As these decisions loom over multiple markets, businesses will need more services from this industry.

Under a recovering economy, this industry will have to deal with lessened inflationary pressures, which will influence the prices or fees it has been charging. Even though companies will still need these services, rivals will make prices more competitive.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Urban Density Will Make Moving Services More Necessary
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Rental housing will become more prominent in the near future, as millions of new apartments will need to be built to keep up with the country's growing population. Specifically, migration into major cities such as New York, Los Angeles, Dallas and Phoenix will be the prime mover for new rental construction in the United States.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The Slowing Housing Market Will Be a Drag on the Industry's Performance
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The housing market will remain weak as mortgage rates are expected to remain high. The Federal Reserve will seek to keep the cost of borrowing elevated to give them more wiggle room to lower interest rates during future recessions. Since existing home sales will remain relatively low, demand for residential moving services will be fairly muted, hindering revenue growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Competition with Substitutes Will Be Intense
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Recently, businesses that provide moving services via mobile apps have started to take business away from the industry and will continue to do so in the future. For example, PODS (portable boxes) can be delivered and picked up at a person's convenience. PODS can also be stored at select facilities and transported between two homes in the owner's car. As these services proliferate, performing the industry's services without hiring a traditional moving company will become more convenient.

industry_definition: Businesses in this industry offer moving and relocation services for clients seeking to move their items to a new destination. Moving services cater to residential and commercial sectors and handle various types of items. Providers often offer incidental packing and storage services.
key_trends: Low barriers to entry mean that there are many entries and exits into the industry. This causes many small companies and owner-operators to become movers, boosting competition.

Business demand for moving services has been low because of high interest rates. Large firms rely on selling moving services to businesses the most, so their poor performance has reduced consolidation and heightened internal competition.

Even with inflationary pressures, moving companies performed relatively well during the current period. A need for moving services to supplement robust corporate and consumer activity in downstream markets led to a surge in the housing and commercial markets, raising revenue.
The use of mobile apps to find movers will become more popular in the near future. This has the potential to replace many traditional moving service companies.

The largest players comprise a relatively small revenue share, indicating fragmentation among moving companies. Relatively low barriers to entry and the lack of differentiation keep concentration low.

Major companies have started to innovate to make the moving experience more efficient for consumers. Larger companies have installed online systems that help customers track their materials during a move, increasing reliability and efficiency.
Regulations regarding truckers on the road have made movers more diligent. They must ensure the truckers they employ have the correct eyesight to drive and sleep enough hours to follow federal laws.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Moving services used by households include residential moving, packing and specialty moving services. Demand from high-income households is very important for this industry because they have the funds to purchase moving services. Households comprise the largest revenue share, as most moves occur between two residences.

Corporate customers pay moving service providers to help move offices or transport materials such as files, technology, bulk goods or pharmaceutical products between different places. The presence of remote work options has challenged the appeal of office spaces and the extent to which they are needed more than before. Such developments have led to various companies downsizing their facilities, influencing the extent of activity in this sector.

Various state and federal government agencies, like the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), purchase moving services when changing their office spaces. Government bodies are often resistant to economic fluctuations, so demand for moving services in this sector has remained stable despite the pandemic, high inflation and rising interest rates. Since spending on other segments has fallen, government agencies' revenue share has crept upward during the current period.

products_and_services.product_description: Movers in this sector help families transport their furniture and household goods from one place to another. This segment includes loading, driving and unpacking services. Local, interstate and international options are available.
Commercial moving services help businesses and government entities relocate their offices and shops.
Warehouses are storage units that hold furniture, equipment and paraphernalia for households and corporations that move between homes and offices or put away extra material.
Other services include packing, handling and freight transportation arrangement services.

tier_1_suppliers: Used Car Parts Wholesaling in the US
Truck & Bus Manufacturing in the US
Truck, Trailer & Motor Home Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Iron Ore Mining in the US
Iron & Steel Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Apartment & Condominium Construction in the US
Office Furniture Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_buyers: Finance and Insurance in the US
Real Estate and Rental and Leasing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Housing prices generally climb when demand for housing is strong, which typically bolsters spending on moving services. Overly high prices can deter consumers from moving into more expensive homes, even when the value of their own homes may swell, hindering revenue. Overall, moving service companies benefit when housing prices rise.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is extensive geographically and is home to major US cities such as Miami, Raleigh, and Nashville. The region has lots of housing and businesses that require moving services, and because of its high population, many moving service providers locate down south. Migration into Southeastern states such as Florida, North Carolina, and Georgia is also elevated, boosting spending on the industry's services.

This region includes states such as Ohio, Illinois, and Michigan, which contain many Fortune 500 companies that rely on industrial production. Industrial corporations must move their materials frequently and require storage space, so there's consistent demand for moving services.

This region is home to major technology companies such as Meta, Alphabet, Microsoft and Apple. These companies manage billions of files, some of which need to be in print, so there's significant demand for storage units in the region. Technology corporations are continuously growing, so they move offices often, raising spending on moving services.

New York contains the largest banks and financial institutions that require storage space to keep their documents. Demand for storage space is high in New York in general, as high rents encourage many businesses to use storage units to put away unnecessary items. There's also significant demand for moving services because many renters in New York shift their dwellings often.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Motor Carrier Safety Improvement Act of 1999
regulations_points.regulation_description: This law establishes requirements for commercial vehicle operators (e.g., moving trucks). Drivers must have a license from only one state, be 21 and complete a physical examination every two years, have a minimum 20/40 vision in each eye and not be color blind.
Drivers over a certain age, complete a physical examination every two years, have a minimum 20/40 vision in each eye and not be color blind.
In 2006, the EPA required that the amount of sulfur in diesel fuel could be no greater than 15 ppm. This was enforced for all on-road vehicles by 2010.
This EPA regulation states that moving companies must have a permit to discharge stormwater from industrial activity into a collective sewer system.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The moving services industry is mature.
The industry assistance level is low and steady.
The competition level is high and steady.

basis_points.basis_description: Low barriers to entry mean that there are many entries and exits into the industry, causing many small companies and owner-operators to become movers, boosting competition.
Business demand for moving services has been low because of high interest rates, reducing consolidation and heightening internal competition among large firms.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Entry and exit into the industry are fairly easy, enabling small movers to gain significant local market share and keeping concentration low.
Self-employment is common in this industry, with nearly half of establishments being nonemployers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase costs comprise contracts for third parties to transport goods, fuel costs and leasing vehicles
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs comprise contracts for third parties to transport goods, fuel costs and leasing vehicles.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Fuel prices have been rising drastically in recent years
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Fuel prices have been rising drastically in recent years, which has put upward pressure on purchase costs.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Companies using own trucks can pass high fuel prices onto consumers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: The companies that use their own trucks have been able to pass these high fuel prices onto consumers, so purchase costs as a percentage of revenue have held steady during the current period.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Costs vary with companies' decisions on wages and contractors
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Costs vary with companies that can elect not to pay more for the workers they hire or rely on contractors to do such forms of work. Such decisions have largely shaped how much wages are paid in the period.
With such factors, wages have been climbing.
The presence of independent contract-based work to handle various parts of company operations has kept wage costs hampered.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: While there are some capital costs, this industry relies heavily on labor, ranging from movers who are willing to travel across the country, office.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Shifts in the confidence index enhance volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: The behavior of economic indicators like the consumer confidence index determines how well consumers feel about the economy and, in turn, will impact the activity level in the housing and commercial sectors, influencing the industry's performance.
Interest rates influence whether businesses or households choose to move, significantly influencing downstream demand for moving services.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Technological Progress in Trucking is Making Residential and Commercial Moving More Efficient
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Trucking has become more efficient, as many moving companies have implemented vehicle coordination systems that track where their trucks are.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Warehouses are at the Forefront of Cost Reduction
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Mobile robots are beginning to replace conveyor belts in warehouses.

FAQs.question: How have recent economic conditions affected demand for industry services?
FAQs.answer: As housing starts have increased, industry revenue has seen an uptick because of the need for the industry's services.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you provide a diversified range of services?
FAQs.answer: All major operators in the industry provide an array of services in addition to the industry relevant moving services.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile crude oil prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Volatility in fuel prices has led to operators increasing their costs.

FAQs.question: Is your company located near large travel hubs?
Does your company use software systems to optimize all aspects of logistics and sales channels?
FAQs.answer: Technological innovation has increased in the industry giving customers ease of access while availing services that the industry provides.

FAQs.question: How is your company investing in technology, such as telematics and big data analysis software, to establish an edge over your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Large operators have vast IT infrastructure in place both internally and externally to provide value-add services to the customers.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Regulation has remained relatively steady in the industry over the past five years.

FAQs.question: How does your company stay ahead of regulations like energy-efficiency standards?
FAQs.answer: Environmental regulations have increased in the industry over the past five years.

FAQs.question: How have volatile input prices affected profit margins over the past year?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins have decreased slightly in the industry over the past five years on account of volatility in fuel prices.

FAQs.question: Do you have any challenges with customers paying on time?
FAQs.answer: Services have a short life-cycle, therefore, payment cycles are also short resulting in less bad debts.

FAQs.question: Do you have a strong reputation among customers? How many customers have you gained from good word-of-mouth recommendations?
FAQs.answer: Moving can be a stressful process for most people. If a company has a reputation for value and efficiency, it is likely to win new and repeat customers.

FAQs.question: Are you able to leverage economies of scale? Do you have any contracts in place for resources such as fuel?
FAQs.answer: Larger companies are better able to reduce costs per mile traveled and use buying power for capital equipment and fuel.

FAQs.question: What regions are your services dominant in? Are you located near major metropolitan areas?
FAQs.answer: The industry is dependent on establishments being able to serve the needs of customers in all locations across the country and abroad.

FAQs.question: Does your company find revenue performance mirrors trends in mortgage rates? What do you do to spur demand when rates are high?
FAQs.answer: When mortgage rates are low, consumers can obtain loans to purchase homes at more affordable rates.

FAQs.question: Do you expect major changes in demand as a result of rising disposable income levels? Do you offer services at a variety of price points?
FAQs.answer: When disposable income is high, households are more likely to spend on convenient services.

FAQs.question: How did your company benefit from increased existing home sales amid the COVID-19 pandemic? What percentage of your customers are moving into existing homes?
FAQs.answer: Existing home sales measure the sales of residential property.
